feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student demonstrates a working financial application: it fetches real-time market/news data, uses sentiment/math divergence analysis, and outputs investment-focused summaries and verdicts (e.g., Apple report with sentiment score and buy/hold guidance). Implementation and reflection evidence show the tool both performs financial tasks and was tested end-to-end, meeting the criterion.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows clear, functional AI integration: live API ingestion, preprocessing (50 articles), a prompting strategy/persona, and an analysis step comparing text to sentiment scores (Implement). The student also framed the problem motivating AI use (Discover) and reflected on the added value (Reflect), satisfying the PASS standard for effective AI integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "my tool doesn't just summarize headlines, it acts as a cynical analyst. It's going to pull real-time data and compare the text against math and identify contradictions to give a clear bias-free verdict."
"this node retrieves raw data raw uh JSON data um containing a list of the latest news."
"So provided an executive summary on Apple. Um very in-depth. ... it gave me some data divergence. So it gave it a sentiment score of 42 out of 100. Um market reality um neutral to bullish."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: defined a clear financial problem (noise vs. truth) motivating a financial tool.  
Implement: described concrete nodes, an HTTP request to Alpha Vantage, JSON news + sentiment inputs, and a chat agent doing divergence analysis on tickers.  
Reflect: articulated that combining live API data with an AI persona produced actionable financial intelligence.
criteria.reasoning: The student demonstrates a working financial application: it fetches real-time market/news data, uses sentiment/math divergence analysis, and outputs investment-focused summaries and verdicts (e.g., Apple report with sentiment score and buy/hold guidance). Implementation and reflection evidence show the tool both performs financial tasks and was tested end-to-end, meeting the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "it's going to take, um, the latest 50 news articles and put it into my AI agent, which is using chat GBT4 mini, and my system prompt um, instructs the AI to perform a divergence analysis, and it's going to check uh, if the text matches the the math, the sentiment score."

"Alpha Vantage provides real-time historical stock data um and can also give you any recent news articles relating to those stocks. So as you can see this node is not just browsing the web it retrieves raw data raw uh JSON data um containing a list of the latest news."
"by combining um a live API data uh stream with a specific persona um I was able to turn raw information into actionable financial intelligence."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: Defined the problem (financial noise, need for truth) motivating AI use.
- Implement: Described concrete nodes (chat node, HTTP request to Alpha Vantage), data flow (JSON news + sentiment), and model (ChatGPT-4 mini) performing divergence analysis.
- Reflect: Articulated the value gained and how AI turned raw data into actionable intelligence, showing conceptual understanding.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows clear, functional AI integration: live API ingestion, preprocessing (50 articles), a prompting strategy/persona, and an analysis step comparing text to sentiment scores (Implement). The student also framed the problem motivating AI use (Discover) and reflected on the added value (Reflect), satisfying the PASS standard for effective AI integration.
